full_text:
Message Payload Transformation

Lesson
objectives ¢ Describe and configure the plugin used to

transform a payload

* Configure a message reference value used
by Guidewire and external system

* Transform a message payload

| Use case

¢ The bank savings account
verification message payload has a
token that needs to be replaced with
the age of the message
* Compare the time the message was
created to the current time
« Areference value needs to be
added to the payload to help identify
the message being sent to the
external system

Gi
Design approach

1. Create message request plugin
class

Create plugin registry
Configure the plugin

Configure the destination

a Fe N

Deploy changes

| Guidewire servers and messaging transactions

DY) .
Event triggering & ¥ Sending message &
Message generation . Payload Process synchronous

i ») transformation acknowled,
igment
A (event fired rules) (request plugin) (transport plugin)

|

Process asynchronous
acknowledgement

¢ All activity from payload transformation takes place in transaction 2
* Messaging occurs across multiple transactions

¢ If an exception is thrown, work in the current transaction is rolled back

Payload late binding Gi

A late binding value (token) is:
+ Amessage payload value that cannot be determined when the payload is generated (event-time)

+ Such a value is obtained and substituted in the payload right before the message is sent (send-time)

* The message request plugin:
+ Responsible for replacing all late binding tokens with actual values in an outbound message

*** Stage 3(a) -- Transforming the message payload with

late binding ***
Request plugin: BankAccountVerificationRequest —

beforeSend()
Replaced token <@@ageOfMessageInSeconds@@> with value 3

Returning payload string

dam

Replace token
with actual age
in seconds

Request (CH),

Plugin t re5

| SenderReflD

* Optional message identifier

¢ Determined by Guidewire, but in some cases, the
external system determines the SenderReflD

¢ Used by:

* The external system to identify which request

message it is responding to

Gi

Optional sender reference set at message send time.

* Guidewire to look up a corresponding pending asynchronous request message

identify failed messages

* Called before the payload is sent by + Transforms the payload
transport plugin + Sets late binding value(s)
* Sets the SenderReflD on the message object * Optionally, adds the SenderRefID value to the

message payload

| Create a message request plugin class Gi

Use a package naming convention recommendation:

* <company>.<app_code>.messaging.<functional_area>

© bankAccountVerficationRequestgs

=>

e

eo

Package trainingepp.messaging.bank

class BankAccountVerificationRequest implements MessageRequest {

GParam("aMessage", "Message object sent by event fired rule")
GReturns("Payload, transformed or not")

override function beforeSend(aMessage : Message) : String (...)
override function afterSend(p0 : Message) (...)

override function resume() (...}

override property set DestinationID(destinationID : int) (...)

override function shutdown() (...)

override function suspend() (...)

Set the SenderReflD Gi

17 @ override function beforeSend(aMessage : Message) : String {

—P 19 if (aMessage.SenderRefID == null) {
=> 20 aMessage.SenderRefID = aMessage.PublicID

}

¢ You must ensure that your beforeSend method implementation is idempotent,
which means that it could be called multiple times and have the same effect.

* Set the SenderReflD only once for a new message

| Transform the payload Gi

—> var transformedPayload = aMessage.Payload
—> if ((aMessage.MessageRoot as BankAccount).AccountType == BankAccountType.TC SAVINGS) {
> 26 + aMessage.SenderRef ID
=> 2 var ageInSeconds = String. valueOf(DateUtil. secondsSince (aMessage.CreationTime) }

29 var token = "<@¢ageOfMessageInSeconds@@>"

if (transformedPayload.contains(token)) {

1 transformedPayload = transformedPayload.replaceFirst (token, ageInSeconds)

2 }
—> return transformedPayload

4 }

contact, ab:5
. bankName,ACME Credit Union
* The beforeSend method should not modify the routingNunber, 123-987
H accountNumber, 345678901
message payload directly

accountly

¢ It should return a transformed payload

| Demonstration G

Examine message payload transformation

click here

Note: The demonstration opens a new tab in your browser. When the demonstration ends, the
original course launch window appears. Return to this window to continue this presentation.

Question

a With regards to payload generation and payload transformation:

oo A) Onwhich server does each take place?

B) At what point in time does each take place?

Seo e Soo e esses see sen

Answer Gi

a With regards to payload generation and payload transformation:
“ A
B

On which server does each take place?

At what point in time does each take place?

A) Payload generation occurs on the application/UI server. Payload transformation
occurs on the batch/integration server.

B) Payload generation occurs during Event Fired rules (right after the triggering event
occurs). Payload transformation occurs right before the message is sent (in the
request plugin's beforeSend method.

Soo ee See eo eS se ese

Question

_— — Under what circumstance would you need to late bind a message
¢ payload?

¢
¢

Seo e Soo e esses see sen

Answer

_— — Under what circumstance would you need to late bind a message
Y payload?
7

You would need to late bind a message if information that needs to go in the message
payload is not known at the time the message payload is generated in Event Fired
rules.

Soo ee See eo eS se ese

review transform a payload

* Configure a message reference value used
by Guidewire and external system
* Transform a message payload

transformation
